title: "I'd rather have a toxic teammate than a bad one"
body:
Do you agree with that statement?

Before you downvote this, this isn't my opinion necessarily, just something for people to discuss here.

With toxic I mean a toxic person that's playing neutral/well but hard flaming all game, vs a friendly person that's playing badly.

Made this topic on the EU boards as well, and it got a massive amount of replies, so I was wondering what the NA community thinks.

replies.body:
While an interesting topic to often discuss, this thread is still a necro which violates the [**Board Universal Rules**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/ITFIpNUE).  As such, I will be applying a lock.

{{sticker:poppy-wink}}

As someone who often plays with friends, and who has friends of varying skill levels, I disagree.  Someone who is legitimately bad at the game can still listen to calls, and they can improve, where as someone who is toxic is already going down a dark path that I just don't want to deal with.

I would much rather have a loss on a friendly team than a win with horrible excuses for human beings.

EDIT:

> Made this topic on the EU boards as well, and it got a massive amount of replies

What was the consensus over there?

> [{quoted}](name=redniwediS,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ObONkji3,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-02-01T21:17:37.415+0000)
>  Someone who is legitimately bad at the game can still listen to calls, and they can improve

I wish I lived in your world.

It just takes a little more effort to live there is all.  If you show people you actually care when you try to help them they seem to listen pretty well.  A lot of people like to be brutally honest about stuff, but from everything I've seen that doesn't get you anywhere quickly, and legitimately being nice to people does.

Be the person you want to have on your team.

The problem I have is, is when people that are actually horrible, won't listen due to sheer stubbornness. You could be as nice as you want, but their ego will refuse to let them come down to earth, and not only do you wind up with someone who won't listen, you also wind up with someone that isn't playing with your team. That situation right there causes a lot of toxicity.
Dude we're talking about a random soloQ game here, not ur duo partner for life.

I didn't poll the thread, cause polls cause posts to die (people come in, vote and leave without discussing) and I want people to discuss. 

But it seems about 60% disagrees just like you, stating that as long as someone tries, he can still be useful, while a toxic person is more likely to throw out of spite or just because he's more busy typing than playing.
Also toxic people drag the team down, making 5 people worse, instead of just one. 

Then you have 39% of people saying they'd rather get carried while muting the toxic person. It's not their problem and if someone is muted he is both useful and shuts up. 
Or that toxicity in general shouldn't be punishable because why is there a mute button. 

AND there's about 1% of people with tinfoil hats saying that riot doesn't want to punish 'trollers and leavers but only wants to punish flamers, and only wants to punish people who spent money to make sure they get a new account and buy more skins. (there were two of them but it was too funny not to include those)

This
Toxic teammates are more likely to int, feed, AFK and generally be an asshole. Simply being bad doesn't mean you're not trying to play the game and be good.

playing well but being toxic doesn't stop someone from inting, feeding or going afk.

i can have a toxic challenger player that ints because bot lane lost first turret
You realize that playing well In a game is exactly the opposite of inting, right?
i cant MUTE  shitty teammates actions. i can MUTE a toxic teammates words.

No. I don't agree in the slightest.

A bad teammate has the potential to lose me a game. So what? This is a video game. It's still possible to have a ton of fun even losing, even getting smashed into the ground and steamrolled.

A toxic teammate has the potential to ruin the game experience. So what? I can mute them, but then I'm cutting off communication, they may still be toxic through pings, and it creates a negative environment for everyone in the game - which not only ruins the fun for everyone but makes it more likely we lose the game, adding insult to injury so to speak.

Yeah, I like winning. But I like not having toxic players more than I like winning.

Having bad player that feeds enemy vayne also ruins game experience and fun for everyone. You are more likely to lose with a guy who has no clue how to play than a guy who knows but is negative and sceptical about his team competence. This riot propaganda that flamer is much worse than troll/bad/boosted player is getting more and more on my nerves.

No... it's not propaganda. Look at this thread, full of real players, giving their opinion - a vast majority would rather have a bad player than a toxic one.

Do you play sports to win? Yeah, but you mainly play them to have fun. Would you rather have a teammate who berates you for every little mistake, like missing a free throw, for the rest of the game? Or would you rather have a teammate who misses a free throw but you all build each other up after it, even if that free throw loses you the game?

If you are in a competitive environment like ranked you play to win because fun is winning. This is with any competitive game or sport. If I am playing an aram then I don't care about winning so id rather have bad teammates than toxic ones.

I'm pretty sure people play to win in competitive sports, not play to have fun. Sure, fun is a good addition, but people would rather take the win rather than have fun in something like the Olympics. Same goes for SoloQ in League.
I would rather have fun with a friendly team in ranked and get hard stomped, than i would winning with a full toxic team.

Das you but the majority disagrees. You can report the toxic guy after he gives you a free win by carrying you or just carrying his own weight. There is legitimately no greater pain in league for me knowing I tried my absolute but despite that, a teammates contribution was so negative that your efforts just completely went to shit.

I'm ready for the downvotes

I'd take the toxic/good player if im in ranked.

The nice/bad player tilts me a bit more. 

Im thinking of real situations ive had. I've seen some of the friendliest people in the game single-handedly lose me a game. Hard. At that point, you're not really trying to win. Climbing is not a thing. 

When riot's popularity is grossly based on competition and promoting competition; it fees a bit unfair when they do a 180 and say "its only a game; just be merry and lose. Being good isnt a big deal". Like, well some people want to be good and try hard in ranked games and want to see the fruits of their labor. 

For me, getting the friendly/bad player is like getting a drunk player on my team. They may be fun and happy, but you know you're going to lose.

If im playing a friendly game; no problem. If im playing a game to win; i'd love to see some people actually try on my team. 

If im being 100% honest, I'd take the toxic/good player. I'll admit; maybe thats not a healthy perspective about a game lol. I kinda wish I really didn't care too much a bout my rank. I meany why? It _is_ just a game. You'd never hear riot promote it as such, but it is. Can you imagine their next marketing campaign? XD "DW its just a game. You don't have to be good. Just have fun."

Ask any pro player in a pro game (maybe even some important promos) who'd they rather have; a friendly/bad player or a toxic/good player.

To elaborate a friendly/bad playing im saying you're pretty much 4v6. Like the player is feeding their entire team, building the worst build ever on their champion, and basically drunk. I can mute or ignore people too verbal in chat. The worst of toxicity I've experienced is somebody pinging too much. Usually (not always) if I tell them to stop they do. So im basing this on what I've personally experienced from either camp.

also it's not like you're legit making friends at the end of the match you aren't likely to befriend them and stay playing with either one of those 2 so if you going to put up with something once from someone it mines well be the benefit. As others have said you can mute and get a good benefit.

I just hate playing with toxic people. I'd much rather play with a bunch of noobs who are friendly than a bunch of good players who are mean.

{{champion:51}}

I've never been tilted by a simply "toxic player." Only players who are soft inting or playing bad AND typing toxic shit. So if you are playing well, you can type whatever you want. Like, if someone is playing well, they are directly helping me out and benefiting me. What they type literally means nothing. I'll never understand people who get tilted by the person **carrying** them.
Mute them, and it becomes a question of whether you want to play with someone playing well or someone playing bad. Pretty obvious choice.
I can mute people so yes.

I prefer toxic teammates because I /fullmute all every game anyways. The only people worth communicating with are my friends in discord. Typing words at my team has never made them play better in my experience.

i vehemently disagree for 2 reasons.

reason 1, this is a game and its meant to be fun.  even if im having an amazing game a toxic ally is a fun black hole, literally the only thing they accomplish is upsetting people, there is no positive to come out of being toxic.

reason 2, being toxic to your team will usually make your team play exponentially worse, both from them purposely playing like crap to ruin your game and from them just tilting hard af.

reason 2.5, on the flip side of reason 2, being a good sport to your allies even when theyre doing bad will not only make the game more enjoyable all around but can often help people to play better, take tips and advice better (im a lot more likely to listen to someone politely telling me not to push than someone flaming their face off at me), and increase teamwork which is obviously central to this game.

so basically, having a toxic teammate IS having a bad teammate
but you can just mute him but you can mute your teamates shittyness
Id rather have a jerkoff asshole draven adc player who knows his champion than a shit ashe player who doesnt know jack.

id much rather have a toxic player on my team than a bad player because bad players make ME toxic and im trying to reform.
riot wont admit it but in most cases its the bad players whose GAMEPLAY is toxic and thats what pisses "toxic players" off
In my experience bad is usually a worse sort of toxic. But I'd rather have a competent asshat then a friendly scrub, pretty hard to win with someone going 3/14/6 rather than 10/4/3
I can mute a flamer. I can't stop a feeder.

More clarity is required for this question. There are following types of players in a particular game:

* Feeding Type (feeds the lane/ bad day, but a team player, winning is priority)
* Toxic Type (toxic carry type also a team player(meaning he will group if required for winning but will still be flaming randomly on the side), winning is the priority)
* Feeding + Egoistic Type (feeds the lane, not a team player, winning might not be the priority since he is not ahead)
* Toxic + Egoistic Type (carry toxic, not a team player, winning might be the priority only through his terms)

People are confusing bad(feeding) types with a preconception that they are non egoistic and are always team player but that is not the case. I have seen split pushing Ashe's in my games, who feed their lane 2v2, and keep on split pushing against a Zed in bot while whole team is asking them for help doing baron. Though they might not be intentionally feeding but their intention is not to win either(since in that particular game they are not the one's carrying so its a loss in their eyes)

Similarly Toxic + Egoistic types are bad for the game too, since they don't group when the team want them to or play as a team. But with them at-least rest of the team can make a decision and group towards their lane for the win, you can not do that with the feeding+egoistic type since they are already behind and they cant dictate objectives like the person who is toxic+egoistic but still carrying.

So the lesser of two evils is toxic+egoistic compared to  feeding+egoistic

Btw. following is the priority from me: Toxic Type > Feeding Type > Toxic+Egoistic > Feeding + Egoistic. Having an egoistic feeder is most definitely a loss, but having a egoistic toxic payer there is still a chance to win it just is a little hard.
He is talking about toxic player who will bring you a win, no matter what over a lovely scrub who certainly lose your game.

then why is there even a choice? i play the game for win, i don't mind if some anon on internet talks sh_t about me it doesn't even make sense to compare the two. But if it is ranked then who wouldn't want to take a win? And why even play ranked if you don't want to win?
